creator: Frances Flora Bond Palmer and James Merritt Ives
title: "High Water" in the Mississippi
subject: Mississippi, Black Americans, Flood

title: Carmen
subject: Twitter, social media
label: Carmen takes its title from Bizet’s famous opera and is built around the melody of the aria Habanera. While the phrase “Love is a rebellious bird” symbolizes the free and untamed love in the original, Stromae reinterprets this “bird” as the icon of Twitter (now X), a symbol of modern social media. The animated music video offers a sharp critique of today’s social media culture, highlighting themes of addiction, consumption, the isolation and superficiality that often come with them.

creator: Moniker
title: Emojis Is All We Have
subject: social media, technology
creditLine: Luna Maurer & Roel Wouters, Emojis is all we have
allow: autoplay; fullscreen; picture-in-picture; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; web-share

creator: Tesai Hokuba
title: Five Beauties
medium: hanging scroll; ink and color on silk
subject: Women
label: The two women on the left play a hand-gesture game called kitsune-ken (fox fists) in which gestures representing a supernatural fox (kitsune) defeat those of a village head (shōya), who defeats a hunter (ryōshi), who in turn defeats the fox. An apprentice courtesan serves tea while a high-ranking courtesan makes a grand entrance. A feast of sashimi and other delicacies sits nearby. (The Met)

creator: Dorothea Lange
title: Japanese American-owned grocery store, Oakland, California (NGA)
subject: Japanese Americans, Forced Removal and Internment, Wartime Civil Control Administration
label: Oakland, Calif., Mar. 1942. A large sign reading 'I am an American' placed in the window of a store, at [401 - 403 Eighth] and Franklin streets, on December 8, the day after Pearl Harbor. The store was closed following orders to persons of Japanese descent to evacuate from certain West Coast areas. The owner, a University of California graduate, will be housed with hundreds of evacuees in War Relocation Authority centers for the duration of the war. (LOC)

creator: Dorothea Lange
title: Migrant mother, Nipomo, California
subject: Migrant Agricultural Laborers, Mothers, Poor Persons

creator: Regina Manyara
title: Physical media alive and well in Japan - Mandarake
subject: otaku collection

creator: Adriaen Hanneman
title: Posthumous Portrait of Mary I Stuart with a Servant
subject: Mary I Stuart, slaves, royalty
label: The English princess Mary Stuart was married to the Dutch stadholder Willem II and died aged only 29. Hanneman painted this posthumous portrait a couple of years later. Mary is ready for a fancy-dress ball and wears a white dress, an ostrich feather turban and a Brazilian feathered cloak. Her servant is fastening a string of pearls, but Mary seems not to notice him. The black boy is reduced to an ‘exotic’ accessory, with which Hanneman emphasizes Mary’s white skin and elevated position. (Mauritshuis)

creator: Yinka Shonibare
title: Refugee Astronaut VIII
medium: fibreglass mannequin, Dutch wax printed cotton textile, net, possessions, astronaut helmet, moon boots and steel baseplate
subject: Migration

creator: Pieter Claesz
title: Still life with a glass of beer and smoked herring on a plate
currentLocation: Museum Boijmans van Beuningen [Rotterdam, The Netherlands]
subject: Food
label: This panel is a masterpiece from Pieter Claesz' monochrome period. The soft light and finely tuned colour palette in this balanced composition produces an atmosphere of calm. With its great simplicity, with only a single glass of beer, a knife, a herring, a bread and the cracked shell of a single hazelnut, this panel sings the praises of 'our daily bread'. (Boijmans)

creator: Olivier Jobard
title: Syrian Cidra fled to Sweden with her uncle Ahmed and aunt Jihan
subject: Migrant, Child
label: Cidra, who escaped from to Sweden with her aunt and uncle, calls her mother who remained in Syria.

creator: Vincent van Gogh
title: The Bedroom
subject: The bedroom
label: This painting is the second of the three distinct versions of Van Gogh's bedroom in his 'Yellow House' in Arles, France; the place where he had a home of his own for the first time. As he wrote in a letter addressed to his brother Theo, the use of bright colors was meant to express 'absolute repose', reflecting his longing for tranquility during the instability brought on by his illness.

creator: Unknown Artist
title: The Earthquake of 1855 (Ansei 2), Japan
medium: woodblock print; ink and color on paper
subject: Earthquake
label: This color woodblock print depicts the Ansei Edo Earthquake, which struck Edo (now Tokyo) in 1855. The accompanying text references previous major earthquakes such as those in 1624 and 1703, highlighting the recurring nature of earthquakes in Japan's history. Known as nishiki-e, these multicolored woodblock prints became popular in the mid-Edo period. At the time, people believed giant underground catfish caused earthquakes, giving rise to a genre known as namazu-e (catfish prints).

creator: Joan Miró
title: The Farm
currentLocation: National Gallery of Art (Washington D.C., USA)
subject: Farmhouse, Animals, Crops
label: These puzzling pictograms of daily life on Joan Miró’s family farm in Montroig, Spain, invite us into a magical world. The dreamlike images attracted author Ernest Hemingway, the painting’s first owner, and did much to inspire the surrealist movement a few years later. (NGA)

creator: Michel Anguierd
title: The Flood
subject: Flood
label: Anguier, a French-born artist active in Rome from 1641-1651, worked with Bernini and Alessandro Algardi and was one of the latter's disciples picked to illustrate Old Testament scenes for the nave of San Giovanni in Laterano. This relief is a sketch-model for one of the series of thirteen stucco reliefs, intended as models for marbles but never subsequently executed, of Old and New Testament scenes. (The Met)
creditLine: Rogers Fund and Director's Discretionary Fund, 1980

creator: Tsubasa Kato
title: The Lighthouses - 11.3 PROJECT
subject: Tsunami, lighthouse, reconstruction
creditLine: Kato Tsubasa, The Lighthouses - 11.3 PROJECT, courtesy of the artist.

creator: Currier and Ives
title: The Soldier's Dream of Home
subject: Civil war, soldier, daydreaming
label: During the Civil War a soldier rests in camp, his rifle and letter by his side, dreaming of reuniting with his wife and child. The memories of family and thoughts of home offer a sense of comfort and hope, providing a universally human moment in the harsh times of violence and uncertainty. Published by Currier & Ives, known for popular prints in 19th-century America.

creator: Mathilde μP
title: The Stone Age Computer
medium: computer, stone, rocks limestone, moss, wood, soil, water, wild plants
subject: Technology
